decks.notes: The deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to control the game and out-value the opponent. It aims to control the board with cards like Terminus and Path to Exile, while also utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to gain card advantage and assert dominance. The deck is built to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through incremental advantages and superior late-game power.

The deck is focused on playing fast and aggressively, with a heavy emphasis on dealing direct damage to the opponent using spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt. The creatures in the deck, such as Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, are there to provide additional damage quickly. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells by dealing damage to them. The deck's goal is to apply constant pressure to the opponent, forcing them to react quickly or risk losing the game.

This Modern Aggro deck focuses on utilizing Hardened Scales to increase the number of +1/+1 counters on creatures, enabling a fast and powerful offense. Creatures like Steel Overseer and Arcbound Ravager benefit greatly from this mechanic, while cards like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker become even more threatening. The deck also includes support cards like Mox Opal and Ancient Stirrings to accelerate gameplay and find key pieces. With a mix of creatures, artifacts, and lands that synergize well with Hardened Scales, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This UW Control deck is focused on utilizing counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Detention Sphere, while also generating card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes a variety of ways to handle threats, from board wipes like Terminus and Supreme Verdict to instant-speed removal like Snapcaster Mage. The deck's land base is also focused on disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Ghost Quarter and Field of Ruin.

The key strategy of this deck is to use powerful card draw and mana acceleration to assemble the combo pieces needed for the Ad Nauseam win condition. By quickly assembling the right cards, including Angel's Grace and Ad Nauseam, the deck can essentially draw its entire library and win the game with either Laboratory Maniac or Lightning Storm. The deck is designed to quickly and efficiently combo off before the opponent has a chance to disrupt the plan, making it a high-risk, high-reward archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck focuses on playing aggresively with Spirit creatures that have flash and disruptive abilities. By leveraging cards like Collected Company and Aether Vial, the deck can quickly flood the board with powerful creatures like Supreme Phantom and Spell Queller while keeping the opponent on the back foot with counter spells and removal. The synergy between cards like Drogskol Captain and Mausoleum Wanderer allows this deck to overwhelm opponents with evasive threats and disruptive tactics, making it a fast and versatile Aggro deck in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence with +1/+1 counters using cards like Hardened Scales, Arcbound Ravager, and Steel Overseer. It also utilizes modular abilities and artifact synergies to create an aggressive and resilient board state. With efficient mana sources, card filtering, and protection tools like Welding Jar, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large creatures like Walking Ballista and Hangarback Walker while leveraging its ability to quickly adapt and react to different game situations.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf, Scavenging Ooze, and Dark Confidant, along with removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board and put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Bloodbraid Elf to generate value and further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the deck aims to be proactive and efficient in winning the game quickly.

This deck aims to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and either Angel's Grace or Phyrexian Unlife to draw the entire deck and win the game with Laboratory Maniac or Lightning Storm. The deck includes various cantrips and ramp spells to help dig for combo pieces and accelerate mana production. It also includes Pact of Negation for protection and Spoils of the Vault for additional card selection. The mana base consists of a mix of fast lands, temples, and pain lands to ensure consistent access to all colors of mana needed for the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient and evasive Spirit creatures, supported by lords like Drogskol Captain and Supreme Phantom, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with countermagic like Spell Queller. Collected Company allows for explosive plays by putting creatures directly onto the battlefield. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Spirits and control the game tempo to secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to stall the game until it can transform Thing in the Ice or use Jace, the Mind Sculptor to control the board and eventually win the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Blood Moon can disrupt the opponent's mana base, giving the deck an advantage. The deck is designed to be reactive and adaptable, giving the player the tools they need to handle a variety of different threats.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence of human creatures that work together to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. By using cards like Thalia, Reflector Mage, and Meddling Mage to slow down the opponent's plays and disrupt their strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive approach. Additionally, the deck utilizes mana acceleration from Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial, along with tribal synergy from Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory, to efficiently cast its creatures and maintain tempo throughout the game.

This deck focuses on quickly playing out a variety of strong Human creatures to overwhelm the opponent and quickly chip away at their life total. By using cards like Thalia's Lieutenant to pump up the team and disrupt the opponent's plans with cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to maintain pressure and control the board state. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck is designed to efficiently close out games before the opponent can set up their own strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to assemble a combination of cards that generate significant mana advantage, allowing for explosive plays and huge turns. By utilizing cards like Krark-Clan Ironworks, Scrap Trawler, and various artifacts, the deck aims to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage to fuel powerful plays and combo off quickly. The deck includes various ways to cycle through cards and dig for essential combo pieces, allowing for consistency in executing its game plan efficiently.

This Red Deck Wins deck focuses on aggressive creatures and direct damage spells to quickly deplete the opponent's life total. By consistently playing low-cost creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, and following up with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, the deck aims to finish off the opponent before they have a chance to set up defenses. Cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel and Searing Blaze provide additional damage and disruption, while Atarka's Command and Boros Charm offer versatile tools to push through the final points of damage.

The deck focuses on using counter spells, removal, and board wipes to control the game, while using planeswalkers and card advantage engines to generate value and outlast opponents. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy, deal with threats efficiently, and ultimately win through attrition and a strong late game presence. It utilizes a mix of powerful control cards, such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, along with versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Path to Exile to dominate the game and come out on top.
